messages.messageBody:
On Jan 17, 2007, at 3:56 AM, Emily Troper wrote:

> I once saw a list somewhere of great movies and books that portrayed
> unschoolers

I have a list of unschoolish movies suggested by unschoolers:

http://joyfullyrejoycing.com/unschooling/unschoolymovies.html

Joyce

messages.subject: films
messages.msgSnippet: Hi there, I once saw a list somewhere of great movies and books that portrayed unschoolers, and now I can t find it!  Anyone know what I m talking about? I
messages.messageBody:
Hi there,

I once saw a list somewhere of great movies and books that portrayed
unschoolers, and now I can't find it! Anyone know what I'm talking
about?

I LOVE this source for videos/DVDs...

http://www.greattapes.com/gt/dvds.phtml

and this is one of our favorite online stores, and we bought some
great films here too:

http://childandnature.com/products.html


Sara Kate (5) has been totally into watching Little House on The
Prairie, we're only on Season 2, and there's like 24 episodes on each
DVD, and a gazillion seasons, right? I remember watching it as a
little girl in the 70's, and it totally holds up today! FINE
entertainment! Sara went to a hula-hooping dance playshop the other
day wearing her pioneer bonnet!

Also she LOVES all 4 Pippi Longstocking movies, I didn't realize it
before, but Pippi is the classic unschooler! I LOVE Pippi!


Emily

in Portland, Oregon
with dh Michael
ds Morgan (12/91)
ds Seth (8/99)
dd Sara Kate (7/01)
and ds Jacob (12/04)

Come play with us at the Life is Good Unschooling Conference in April
2007!




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
